statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -18 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 7 \\ 4 \\ 7 \\ 23 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 2 \\ -1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -18 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 7 \\ 4 \\ 7 \\ 23 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
